result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:32 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  INCLUDES: ARGN for 21CF593 and STC for 21CF732, 21CF865, 22CF12, 22CF42, 22CF104 & 22CF239    Defendant Jacob Ryan Clemenson in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Jacob Ryan Clemenson.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.   21CF593:  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Atty Erdman has not received Discovery yet.   Adjourned: 3:40
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 08:30 am.

10;04  AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court w/Jacob Ryan Clemenson. INCLUDES: 22CF593 (PH), 2021CF732, 2021CF865, 2022CF12, 2022CF42, 2022CF104, and 2022CF239 (all STC). Court calls 22CF593 - S/T Officer Tim Rue, Hudson PD; direct by Atty Smestad. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Erdman. Atty Erdman moves for dismissal. Atty Smestad responds. Further cross by Atty Erdman. Attys argue bond over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Erdman notes that there is likely a resolution on all matters. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 10:19 am.

INCLUDES 21CF593, 21CF732, 21CF865, 22CF12, 22CF42, 22CF104 and 22CF239. Set for PLEAS. ADA Smestad recites agreement. for continuance of 6/1 PSC. Filed by PD's Office. km

Felony Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 4/15/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

Settlement conference on May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

01:32 PM ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Jacob Ryan Clemenson appeared from jail via video. DE qualifies for PD services. Atty Dolfi notes Atty Erdman is appointed on other files. Will assist for today. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court will inquire further at the next hearing regarding the unpaid attorney fees. DE makes statement. Atty Dolfi waives time limits. Court will accept waiver and schedule. Atty Erdman may request a preliminary hearing.  Settlement conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
